caption.p: DelNS1 LAIV induces cross protective T cell responses against influenza viruses. (A) Induction of antigen-specific CD8 + and CD4 + T cells by CA4-DelNS1 LAIV was estimated by intracellular cytokine staining (ICS) of ex vivo peptide-stimulated splenocytes, followed by flow cytometric analysis. (B) Schedule of T cell depletion and virus challenge. Vaccinated mice were injected intraperitoneally (i.p.) with 100 μg of anti-CD8α or anti-CD4 or with both anti-CD8α and anti-CD4 or with isotype control (IgG2b) antibodies on day 17 (D17), D19, and D21 after immunization and day 3 after virus challenge. (C) Mice were challenged with H7N9 virus (10 MLD 50) on day 21 after vaccination and monitored for 14 days. (D) Mice were challenged with mouse-adapted CA4 (H1N1) virus (10 MLD 50) and monitored for 14 days. Body weight data represent mean values ± standard deviations of results from 7 mice. Statistical comparisons between means were performed by Student's t test. ***, P < 0.001; **, P < 0.01.
